title: Interpretation of $Z$-Score
question_text: Mr. Henry informed one of his calculus students, Randy, that his score of $68 \%$ on his unit exam had a $Z$-Score of $-2.3$. Which of the following is a correct interpretation of Randy's $Z$-Score?

choices.text: Randy's score of $68 \%$ is $2.3$ Standard Deviations above the class average.
Randy's score of $68 \%$ is $2.3$ Standard Deviations below the class average.
Randy's score of $ 68 \% $ is $-2.3$ Standard Deviations below the class average.
The Standard Deviation of the exam data is $2.3$.
Impossible to answer without knowing the mean and standard deviation of the exam data.
